7 days. The first three steps take 1 day. The fourth steps is with the concrete. Add 2 days. Stuff done during the drying doesn't count. 3 more days for the next step and 1 day for the building. 7 total days.

questions.question_text:
A homeowner wants to build a fence. It will take:
✑ A quarter of a day to measure the length of the fence
✑ Half a day to acquire the materials
✑ A quarter of a day to dig holes for the posts
✑ A quarter of a day to set the posts with concrete
✑ Two days for the concrete to dry
While the concrete is drying, the homeowner will spend a quarter of a day cutting the lateral pieces to size, half a day applying the coating to the remaining pieces, and then three days waiting for the coating to dry. It will then take the homeowner one day to assemble the fence. Which of the following is the length of time it will take the homeowner to build the fence?
